title: Thresh Hooks Heard Around the World

replies.body: AD CARRY THRESH! also, this is completely unrelated, but i think we'd all like to see a cinematic of a Pentakill live performance right?

Agreed. Please.
Uhh you got the wrong time on the first video o_O
The play was also really boring, so after wasting all that time trying to find it I was just disappointed.
Seriously guys, Thresh hooked someone, clearly the world has changed. He can land a skill shot! (can't see any other reason for that to be a big play.)

Not Lemonation
So, maybe you guys should, like, balance it  :P
But it is Balcanced

Hitting one skillshot that is not an ult should not have that much impact, i dunno about that

edit: So you people are telling me you never, ever get hit by a hook?  Cause if you do, you're bad, right?  Give me a break.

If thats the case then they should nerf leona, alistar, braum, etc and for the record his one skill shot isnt that impactful he also has to flay correctly, lantern people in if needed, ult properly etc. All cc supports are brutal if in the right hands. Thresh just seems op because hes a safe pick.
Alistar has a skill shot?
@Seth: he's just listing champs with a lot of CC abilities.

Uh... what? Hook #1 that supposedly "sparked a comeback". I had to wade through 30 minutes of video after the part that was marked to actually find said hook, only to see that Thresh actually wasn't even responsible for NWS's first kill. His hook missed.
The right part of the video should have been at 47:07, because of {{champion:412}} 's hook, they got the kill off on {{champion:26}} . Just to let you know, if you saw a different part.

Actually the second paragraph under the video read:

"NWS's first kill came in bot lane, when Thresh used his great positioning to keep Lucian in lane long enough for Tristana to run into Alliance’s range. Even though Thresh missed his hook in this fight, his strong zoning presence -- and the constant threat of a potential hook -- allowed him to force Lucian to run in a dangerous direction."

So I think they did mean to show the part where Thresh missed because they felt he and his missed hook attempt/potential to hook was a factor in that kill that was the start of the comeback.  I, like I think everyone else who watched that video, wish I had read that first and spared myself the time of looking for a mind-bogglingly precise hook that picks off the key player on the opposing team when they were just trying to point out the effect that the threat of such a hook has on the way someone plays.
This whole post was poorly made. Please don't make me skip around through 30 minutes of footage..
(In case anyone didn't see this) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WvJmS0OmD98
{{champion:64}} I think we've all seen that one
{{champion:64}}  i didnt
{{champion:161}}  oh but eye i do
Plz stop with this posts and try to get original. These puns have been on every post since the release of the champs.

The first thing i think about when i hear thresh is a slaver. Mainly because Lucian's wife or sister or whatever, was taken away and they're both black. Also he has a hook that looks like a whip... just saying.

Why did Championship {{champion:412}} ever come back on sale? Championship Riven never did, and she also got an icon for purchasing. also, Championship {{champion:412}} has an icon on his back signifying Season 3, not Season 4.

Wanna know why? Championship thresh was released for season 3 worlds. Shyvana is the season 4 championship pick. Secondly riven was released as limited(like pax skins etc) meaning they will never release again after theyre gone and thresh was legacy meaning depending on the circumstances it will release again ie harrowing, winter games, winter solstice etc. But since skin shops have closed apparently all limited edition skins will rerelease at future dates as well as giving original owners something on the splash art to indicate it.
And Also what desides if a champion is legacy? a Championship skin for SEASON THREE shouldn't be able to purchase in SEASON FOUR
Championship Riven was for season 2 worlds. Championship Thresh was for season 3. Championship Shyvana for season 4 worlds. so Why put any of these in different seasons?

yeah and spend like 10 years for each of them. no thank you riot has other things to do like work on season 5 and balance champions and get the tribunal back up

Lol, he's constantly nerfed all the time. His kit itself is just too good though, and if they changed his kit, Riot would have a riot on their hands.
